Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, well I did not get the job in New York, but I got the real prize, domestic bliss. Jan made me breakfast this morning... well she bought the milk. It's soy. [walks into bedroom, Jan sleeping on bed] This is why I do it, that's what I have to come home to. [sighs] She probably won't be up for a few hours.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is going to be a very good year. Very good. Jan is at home. Jim is back. My protege Ryan is at corporate. Good stuff. Um... Andy and Dwight are rockin' the sales team. I feel very blessed. [slams on breaks, camera turns, Meredith rolls off the hood]

Quote.Speaker: IT Tech Guy
Quote.Text: You know generally it's not a good idea to click on offers that you haven't requested. What was the exact offer?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was for a video.

Quote.Speaker: IT Tech Guy
Quote.Text: Yeah, what kind of video?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: A celebrity sex tape.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really, what kind of celebrity?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not relevant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How much did you pay for it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not relevant.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You paid for it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It all happened so fast.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I broke up with Karen after the job interview, and uh... it was a little awkward when she came back from the city. She told me, very clearly, just because we were broken up didn't mean she was going anywhere, because she worked really hard for her career. But the next day her desk was empty, and as for me and my current romantic life, I uh... I'm single now and looking, so if you know anybody.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim and I went to dinner a few times when he got back from New York. I talked him through his break up. It's really nice to be good friends again.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me, Pam and Jim are totally hooking up. All they do is smile; they're just keeping it a secret. Right? [looks at Oscar]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't know, there is no evidence of intimacy. They've been in remarkably good moods. It could be other things.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Sunday I'm thinking of going to that flea-market at the drive-in.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh that sounds fun. I'm mountain biking on Sunday. On Montage Mountain.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well have fun with that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ladies and Gentlemen. I have some bad news. Meredith was hit by a car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It happened this morning in the parking lot. I took her to the hospital, and the doctors tried to save her life. They did the best that they could... And she is going to be OK.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you? Why did you have to phrase it like that?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So she's really going to be fine?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. She has a slight pelvical fracture, but, ah... people have survived far worse.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank God you were there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Did you see who did it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No need we can just check the security tapes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gah. Kind of a good news bad news there. I was able to be on the scene so quickly because I was in the car that hit her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who was driving?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: One day Michael came in complaining about a speed bump on the highway. I wonder who he ran over then.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's only Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's only Meredith, thank God. But did you see the way they looked at me? Like I was a murderer or something.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey... Why did you do it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was an accident.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Was she talkin' back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you get sick of that face? Did she owe you money? Uh-oh. Is this downsizing? Did she spurn your advances?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey guys, we're all gonna visit Meredith at lunch. And we're kicking in $5 for flowers.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Who's we, you and Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, uh, me Stanley and Phyllis so far.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet Jim goes too.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I haven't asked him yet.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet you ask?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was planning on it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I bet you were.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [whispers to Kevin] Subtle.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Angela] Are you coming?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't, Sprinkles is sick.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: She's been sick for some time. Thank you for asking, no one asks... about Sprinkles.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to give her her meds, I have to pet her, and who will she eat lunch with?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can't your other cats keep her company.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There's bad blood, jealousies, cliques.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela, you're the chairman of the party planning committee. I shouldn't even be planning this, it's your job.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sighs] All right!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My lord my liege.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So Ryan got promoted to corporate, where he is a little fish in a big pond. Whereas back here in Scranton I am still top dog, in a fairly large pond. So who is the real boss? The dog or a fish?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So I need a little treat for the gang. Something to win their affections back.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Back? Why is that Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I ran down Meredith in my car.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh! Did you do this on purpose?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I was being negligent. But she's in the hospital, she's fine, recovering nicely. Tiny little crack in her pelvis. But she will be up in...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Did this happen on company property?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. It was on company property, with company property, so... double jeopardy, we are fine.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I don't think you understand how jeopardy works.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, right, I'm sorry. What is: we are fine?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [sigh]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: People keep calling me a "Wunderkind"; I don't even know what that means. I mean, I know what it means, it means very successful for your age, so I guess it makes sense, but... it's a weird word.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey D.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey monkey, what's up?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can you do me a little favor? Go to my place at lunch and give Sprinkles her medicine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have to visit the alchy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Check to see if she's faking. If a car hit me, it wouldn't crack my pelvis. You know what; I bet she cracked it at home. Jumped in front of the car to get some workers comp.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wouldn't put it past her.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what do you need me to do?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I wrote it out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There's a diabetes shot, roll the insulin in your hand, don't shake it. She gets an ace inhibitor with her meal, but you have to put her right in front of the dish or she won't see it because of the cataracts. Mix one capsule of omega fatty acid in with her kidney medicine, um... and you want to give that to her 15 minutes after she's eaten. And, oh and there's a fungal cream because she has this infection under her tail, so you're gonna have to lift her tail and put the cream right at the base of her tail.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, I have an announcement.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You pushed Darryl out the window?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You shot Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! That is not funny, I love my employees, even thought I hit one of you with my car. For which I take full responsibility. Look I'm just trying to take everybody's mind off of this unavoidable tragedy, and onto more positive things. So I thought we should plant a tree.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh good, so we don't have to work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: OK, we're leaving for the hospital at 1.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, like a freedom tree.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can take 3 people.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can also take 3 people.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [to Kevin] Separate cars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright, I will get a card at the hospital and we'll sign it outside her room.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sales people can go later in the day. Hourly works can go at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, good good, so we'll just all go down there together at lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Excellent!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was thinking that we...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good work Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yaaaaaay, Pam! Alright, since I am the boss I will drive as well. Who wants shotgun?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You can't be serious. You ran a woman over this morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone inside the car was fine, Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Guess what, I have flaws. What are they? Oh, I don't know. I sing in the shower. Sometimes I spend too much time volunteering. Occasionally I'll hit somebody with my car. So sue me... No, don't sue me. That is the opposite of the point that I'm trying to make.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Eww. I hate hospitals. In my mind they are associated with sickness. Oh... She looks like an angel.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: She looks awful.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... OK, she always looks like that... That is not my fault.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think she's awake.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No... She's in a coma.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK... Meredith, [hauntingly] Ooooohhhhh. I brought all your friends from the office dear.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: At the same time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hello Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: This is weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Brought you some balloons. Why don't we... here you go. [wraps them around her IV] Tie these up, cheer up your tubes... [IV pops out] Oh! Shhhh... For God's sake!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nurse.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No don't bother the nurse, just put it back in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [groaning] I am going to be sick... I'm gonna puke.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I wouldn't... I wouldn't worry about it. Don't touch it.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: What, what are you doing? Just gimme that.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Does it hurt terribly?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No, it's not too bad. They have me on a lot of painkillers.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh really, what kind? Codeine, Vicodin, Percocet, Fentanyl, Oxycontin, Palladone? What...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Well it was really great of all of you to come and visit me at the same time. I'll see you guys at the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, OK... Wait up, wait up, guys guys guys, hold on a second. You know what I was thinking might be sort of fun? Is if you forgave me in front of everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Michael, I'm not gonna do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cause you know what they say in the Bible about forgiveness? Forgiveness is next to Godliness.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, that's not. That's next to cleanliness.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, just shhhh... just just...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You cracked my pelvis

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Look, I just... I don't understand what is preventing you from laughing this off and giving me a big hug.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're not forgiven.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on. [starts to climb onto the bed with meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael! Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [screams]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do I need to be liked? Absolutely not. I like to be liked. I enjoy being liked. I have to be liked. But it's not like a compulsive need to be liked. Like my need to be praised.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Any problems?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well you left the TV on, and your cat is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sparkles, the white one, is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sprinkles.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That was the sick one, right?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Uh-huh. But I thought she had more time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did she look... When you saw her how was she looking?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really dead. Like a... just a dead cat.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sobbing]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So... Hey come on, don't be sad, just... OK... just. She's in a better place.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually the place that she's in is the freezer, because of the odor.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [still sobbing]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Angela] It's gonna be OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, you know what? Everybody, let's just get over the whole Meredith thing. She cracked her pelvis, a tiny little crack. She going to be fine, so let's just...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, Angela's cat died.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sprinkles?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sighs] Oh, sh... I'm sorry Angela. Man what a day huh? How could it get any worse? Her computer crashes with the porn, and then Meredith with the accident, and then... Sprinkles! God, that's 3 things. I'll tell you what's going on. This office is cursed, and we need to do something about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I am taking responsibility. It is up to me to get rid of the curse that hit Meredith with my car. I'm not superstitious, but... I'm... I am a little-stitious.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did anyone do anything involving an Indian burial ground?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like park on it. Or dig up a body... Toby? Anything you want to tell us?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, I did not violate an Indian burial ground. In fact I had some good luck recently, Alfredo's Pizza, picked my business card out of the basket, so... uh, I got a week of free pies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Perfect. So our tragedy is your good luck. Satan.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sprinkles never hurt a soul. God in your infinite wisdom how could you do this? She wasn't ready. She had so much left to accomplish.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She's only a cat.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You never... you don't like them.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cats do not provide milk or wool or meat.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Dwight please!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you haven't seen Meredith yet, have you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I have not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I think you should go to the hospital, and pay your respects.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I do not respect her, but I will go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, I would now like to talk about each of your individual religious beliefs.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael, you can't ask about religious beliefs...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Satan is a master of lies. Everything he says is the opposite.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright, well then you can ask about religious beliefs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you for the permission. Psych! Alright let's just go around the room, and tell me what you believe in.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm... um, Catholic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Presbyterian.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh me too.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [puts hand up for high five] Same religion.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright! [high fives Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm a Lutheran and Bob's a Unitarian. It keeps things spicy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: That's why we're cursed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I've been involved in a number of cults, both as a leader and a follower. You have more fun as a follower, but you make more money as a leader.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kelly, you are Hindu, so you believe in Buddha.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: That's Buddhist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you?

Quote.Speaker: IT Tech Guy
Quote.Text: Well if you're going to reduce my identity to my religion then I'm Sikh, but I also like Hip-hop and NPR, and I'm restoring a 1967 Corvette in my spare time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, 1 Sikh, and...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: As a farmer, I know that when an animal is sick, sometimes the right thing to do is to put it out of its misery. With the electricity we're using to keep Meredith alive we could power a small fan for 2 days. You tell me what's unethical.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Blink once if you want me to pull the plug.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Don't pull any plugs.

Quote.Speaker: Intern
Quote.Text: How are you doing Ms. Palmer?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Better.

Quote.Speaker: Intern
Quote.Text: Excellent.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are you a doctor, or a male nurse?

Quote.Speaker: Intern
Quote.Text: Um... I'm an intern, which makes me a doctor, but...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pfft... Her chart doesn't indicate that she had a hysterectomy but she did, or at least she got time off for one.

Quote.Speaker: Intern
Quote.Text: Ah, so uh... so that is where her uterus went... Um, Ms. Palmer, your last tetanus shot was when you were bitten by a bat a few months ago?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes. Dwight here, trapped it in a bag against my head.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just doing my job.

Quote.Speaker: Intern
Quote.Text: It also says you were recently bitten by a raccoon?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: And a rat. Separate occasions.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You spend your whole life trying to get people to like you, and then you run over one person with your car. [sighs] And it's not even one of the popular ones, and everybody gets on your case. Doesn't make any sense... God is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If there was a God then Ryan and I would be married by now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe believing in God was the mistake. What did people believe in before? The sun? Maybe there's some sort of animal, that we could make a sacrifice too. Like a giant buffalo, or some sort of monster, like something with the body of a walrus with the head of a sea lion. Or something with the body of an egret with the head of a meerkat. Or just... the head of a monkey, with the antlers of a reindeer, with, ah... the body of a porcupine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I will do some research.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I can help you with that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So, just to be safe they are giving her the rabies vaccine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God, Rabies?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I was in the hospital room with her. How contagious is that, is that like an STD?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no. You've gotta be bitten by something.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This place is so cursed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Actually the doctor said it was lucky she came in to the hospital, cause the only way to beat rabies, is to start treatment before the symptoms set in... Lock jaw.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [walks out into the office] I know a lot of you are upset with me for endangering Meredith's life by hitting her, with my car. But it may make you feel a little better to know that before that happened, Dwight endangered her life, by putting a garbage bag over her head that had a bat in it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Six of one, really.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Turns out Meredith has been exposed to rabies. Which is like 10 times worse than a little crack in your pelvis. Thanks to me she went to the hospital and I saved her life. Curse is broken. Curse is broken people! [Kevin claps] Oh... there is a God, and he has a plan for us after all. So go home get some rest, very very good work today. We got a lot accomplished.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is there a God? If not, what are all the churches for? And who is Jesus' dad?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [Pam walks out of the office into the parking lot alone. Kevin pops up from the back seat of his car as if spying] Oh well, if they aren't together now, then they probably never will be. I thought they'd be good together, like PB&J. Pam Beasley and Jim. What a waste. What - A - Waste!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam's car pulls out of parking lot and then off to the side of the road] I told you I'm not dating anyone. And even if I was, I don't think it's anyone's business. I mean, when I do fall in love, like when it's for real, the last person I'm gonna talk about it too is a camera crew, or my co-workers. [Jim gets into the passenger side] Almost marrying Roy Anderson was as close to Pamela Anderson as I ever want to be. [Jim leans over and kisses Pam] Trust me, when I fall in love, you'll know.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael Scott's Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, Meredith Palmer memorial, celebrity rabies awareness, fun run race for the cure, this is Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pro-Am.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Pro-Am race for the... They hung up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A woman shouldn't have to be hit by a car, to learn that she may have rabies. But that is where we are in America. And that does not sit right with me. And that is why I'm hosting a fun run race for the cure for rabies. To raise awareness of the fact that there is a cure for rabies. A disease that has largely been eradicated in the US. But not very many people know that.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [on the phone] No, rabies... Babies would be a good idea. Can I put you down for a dime?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi Stanley, how many sponsors so far?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Zero.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on man, gotta step it up! It's for a good cause. Jan called this morning and pledged $500.00.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Isn't that your money?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That... is for a good cause. Phyllis, how's the rabies quilt coming?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh, it's coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, look at that, 3. Way to honor Meredith, Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You cannot make me run.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. [walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It is not a real charity. It's stupid Michael, and I'm not gonna do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright, alright.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You didn't run for me...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shhh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: ...when I thought I had skin cancer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know that you're probably scared of people seeing your fat legs in shorts.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, well back in olden times, a large fat person, like this, was a person of power. A person who had money, could buy food, person of respect. Like the regional manager of the day. Whereas, someone athletic and trim, like myself, was someone who worked in the fields... And I was a peasant.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I just don't want to run. I didn't bring my sneakers or my clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you're going to have to run, or you're going to be in a lot of trouble. It is not olden times anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in bathroom] I'm petrified of nipple chafing. Once it starts it is a vicious circle. If you have sensitive nipples, they chafe, so they become more sensitive, so they chafe more. So... I take precautions. [tapes a cotton ball to each nipple]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Angela. Hey, um... I'm sorry about your cat. [Angela starts to cry]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is Sprinkles. [holds up a picture] She was my best friend. I kept her going through countless ailments. I asked Dwight Schrute to feed her once, and she is now deceased. This is Halloween last year, [picture of Angela holding Sprinkles] just a couple of kittens [starts to cry] out on the town.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Pssst. I'm having relationship problems. And since you're always having relationship problems, I thought you'd be able to give me some advice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I have this crazy thought, that I know is crazy. That maybe Dwight killed my cat.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: When I got home, Sprinkles' body was in the freezer where Dwight said he left her, but all my bags of frozen french fries had been clawed to shreds.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Something's not right. The vet's doing an autopsy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Did Roy ever kill one of your cats?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm more of a dog person.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So what's your strategy for this race?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I'm gonna start fast.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then I'm gonna run fast in the middle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Then I'm gonna end fast.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why won't more people do that? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cause they're just stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [looks at camera] What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Pam and Jim watch video of their kiss on the tv] Oh, ah... No that's not... I mean that wasn't, ah...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah... That was um...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean I can see how it would seem a bit like we uh... How it looks like um... I mean now a days you can edit anything, right? I mean you can edit anything to look like um... anything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I gave him a ride home because...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... We're dating.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! There it is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah, yeah. We haven't told anybody, but it's going really great. [looks at Jim] Right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It is going really great.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Angela runs into Dwight] Oww!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're taking this out on me, but I was only the messenger.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] You'll feel better after the 5k. Exercise is good for depression.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [pushes her chair into Dwight's legs] I'm not depressed I'm in grief.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have raised, almost $700.00, most of it from me and Jan. Um... when do they put that on the giant check? Or is that something that we write in later?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well a giant check costs about $200.00 to make up. I have a print shop standing by but... What do you think Michael, that's over 25% of our funds?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hmm... That's a tough decision. Um... I always imagined it with a giant check. So...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean I personally am definitely on board for the giant check.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Giant check it is.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I don't know, on the other hand it does leave less money for bat birth control.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bat birth control

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, this money is going to bat birth control, right Michael, that's what you told me when I contributed.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You didn't contribute very much. I was also hoping to hand the giant check to a rabies doctor. And how's that been going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not well. A doctor won't come out to collect a check for $700.00, or $500.00 if we go with the giant check.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which we are.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And also there is no such thing as a rabies doctor.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about a rabies nurse?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know what though, I've actually seen ads for nurses that you can hire by the hour, for parties and bachelor events.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's possible. Look into that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great, it's gonna cost a couple a hundred buck and ah... oh actually more with tips.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe we should just skip the ceremony and setup a college fund for Meredith's son.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have you met that kid? He's not going to college.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, 5k means 5 kilometers, not 5 thousand miles. [knocks]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You said come in!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No I didn't, just please don't...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So I closed the door but the image of his...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Baquette.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... dangling participle...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Eww.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ... still burned in my eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can imagine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Michael knocks slowly on door] Come in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: May I enter the room?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. Or come in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: See how I did that. That's the way you should enter a room. You knock and then you wait for the all clear.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You couldn't have taken off all your clothes in the men's room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, but I have an office, so why would I do that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: On average, how many hours a day do you spend naked in your office? Just ballpark.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: European offices are naked all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They're so not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Besides my shirt tail covered most of it so...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I didn't see where it started but I saw where it ended.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sighs] Gross.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not gross, it is the human body. What is your problem? Pam you're an artist, right? Think of me as one of your models. OK, you know what, I don't want this to detract from what we really need to be thinking about today, it's not fair to people with rabies. And that's the point, right? OK, let's go have some fun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: They say if you're nervous around someone you should picture them naked. I do not recommend this strategy. Try picturing them with more clothes on... or a funny coat.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [naked from chest up] Oh, I'm sorry, is this a working office, and not a French beach?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: OK, name please.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Creed Bratton, 75 plus division.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: You're over 75 years old?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: 82 November first. How much is the prize money?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: There's no prize money.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What, is any of this real?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Check that out. [points to Toby] Look at me, I'm Toby, I'm stretching, I know what I'm doing. Why is he even here?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: So I heard that you were peeping on Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What? Look, no it was not...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I don't know what your deal is, but he's mine, OK? So hands off.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK everybody, listen up. Thank you for coming. Before we get started I wanted to say a few words about this deadly disease called rabies. And I'd like you to take a look into the face of rabies. [turns around a picture of Meredith in the hospital] That should scare you. It scares me. You people need to educate yourselves. Myth: 3 Americans every year die from rabies. Fact: 4 Americans every year die from rabies. How many of you know someone who has been afflicted or affected by rabies? Show of hands. One, two, three... too many to count. It is truly the silent killer. No, it is the foaming barking killer. And it is something... Darryl what are you doing.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [feeding a squirrel] I'm giving him a peanut.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, don't give him... just, did you hear anything I said?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look how happy he is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He's happy because he's insane. You know what, that's the perfect example of the kind of awareness we need to generate. Where's the nurse? [Elizabeth walks up in nurse's outfit] This is the reason we're here.

Quote.Speaker: Elizabeth
Quote.Text: Hello Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey, I know you... Elizabeth?

Quote.Speaker: Elizabeth
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right? Wow, very cool you went back and got your degree. I would like you to accept this check, for $340.00 made out to science. Make sure that, that gets into the right hands.

Quote.Speaker: Elizabeth
Quote.Text: Great. [everyone claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You got it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK, fettuccine alfredo, time to carbo-load.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just remember folks, it's not about winning, it is about finishing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On your marks, get set...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pulls Toby's pants down] Beow!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey! [extremely loud gunshot]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On your left!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're doing great Michael, look at you go!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's my boss! Yeah-ha baby!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am fast! I'm very fast! I'm like Forrest Gump, except I am not an idiot. [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar get into a cab]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh yes I will work out today. I will work out a way to avoid running for a stupid cause.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've walked 2 marathons. Pretty sure I can handle a 5k. Key is drafting, eliminate wind resistance. [running right behind Kevin]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. [laughs] Oh we're in last place.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, would you look at that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Darn it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Water? Water? [Toby gabs water, drinks, then throws back at Jan] Water babe?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no water for me. Not while rabies causes fear of water... solidarity!

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Michael that's irrational.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Rabies victims... have to live with an irrational hatred of water their entire lives. So... least I could do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh God! My nipples, it's starting.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar sitting at a table] Can we get another round?

Quote.Speaker: Waitress
Quote.Text: OK.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So we've got what, another 20 minutes?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: More or less.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmmm...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That fettuccine is sitting in my stomach like a rock.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You've got nothing to worry about, I put Imodium in Toby's coffee before the race.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] Excellent! ...Simpsons. Wait, Imodium or Ex-lax?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm makin' great time. Usually I have to take a bathroom break half way through a race like this, but not today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooo! An estate sale. Wanna go in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know I'm really committed to winning.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, but what if I told you all the money you spend here, goes to preventing a disease that's already been cured.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm... Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's what I thought.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right. Let's do some good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [Ryan looks at the phone as it rings... [Pam's voice] [You have reached the offices of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, currently the entire staff is out doing the Michael Scott, DM FM PMC rabies awareness Pro-Am fun run race... [Michael's voice] for the cure... [Pam's voice] leave a message" Ryan hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [Burp] Oh God, Oh, alfredo sauce. I'm getting a stitch. [groans]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [runs into the back of Kevin] Ah, God watch the nipples, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Back off me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How ya feeling, better?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well you look cute as a button. You've worked up quite a sweat.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The vet is removing all of Sprinkles organs right now and sending them to the lab.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I am a farmer Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK, when a farmer sees an animal that is in pain, that has no quality of life, that has no utility, a farmer does what city folk don't have the stomach to do.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You did kill her!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I... I sang her, her favorite songs.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You put her in my freezer.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was beautiful and gentle and respectful. I fed her antihistamines and she gradually fell asleep.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well then she barfed them up in the freezer and tried to get out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I'm not responsible for that!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You! [hits Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, Oww! [looks around to onlookers] It's OK.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's OK.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's nothing, I'm robbing her.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's fine. What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How could you do that without telling me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I thought I was helping you. I expected a hug. I took care of that cat, the best way I knew how.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Cat Heaven is a beautiful place, but you don't get there if you're euthanized.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know a great taxidermist. I'll pay to have her stuffed. Well he's not great, but he's pretty good.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You don't understand.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [runs by] Take bat bites seriously. Don't get bit.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Or we can have her buried out at the east field, by mother. Huh, Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't touch me Dwight! [runs off crying]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [holding lamp] You like it? It's kinda designy and cool, it was $8.00.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, and I get to carry it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [crosses finish line] And the winner is Toby Flenderson.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Have a seat, I'll write it down.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Where are we?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I dunno, like 5 kilometers from the office.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: He couldn't have made it a circle?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [bent over] I am not going to finish. I can't beat rabies. Nobody can beat rabies, rabies has been around for a thousand years. I was a fool to think that I could beat it. [Creed,Stanley, and Oscar pass by in the cab and get out at the finish line]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: ...talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah probably. Hey, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you doing here? Did you come back for us, or...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't finish. I feel so weak, I just...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, you're probably dehydrated.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you want me to do Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Glass of water would be a start.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, There are people all over the world, who have all sorts of problems and afflictions, and diseases. They're deformed, and they're abnormal, and... they're illiterate and ugly. Symphonies don't have any money. Public TV is bust. I can't do anything about it, I can't... you know. There's just one of me, and there's a thousand of them. And rabies wins.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! You are a downer. We were having a pretty nice day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm still having a nice day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Hey Michael, look at this lamp. $8.00.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a good deal.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And Michael, you don't have rabies. And chances are you're not going to get it anytime soon. So... you don't really have to think about it too much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, if everybody felt that way, nothing would get done.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, but there's other, better people out there who are helping.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You just don't think I am capable, of making a difference.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know you Michael, I saw you naked.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't, you don't know me. You've just seen my penis. I can make a difference, remember, I'm the one who started this whole thing off by hitting Meredith with my car. And I owe it to her to finish this... GD 5k [gets up groaning, Jim tries to help] No, no!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Finishing that 5k, was the hardest thing I have ever had to do. I ate more fettuccine alfredo and drank less water, than I have in my entire life. People always talk about triumphs of the human spirit, well today I had a triumph of the human body. That's why everybody was applauding for me at the end. My guts and my heart, and while I eventually puked my guts out, I never puked my heart out. And I'm very, very proud of that.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey Mer. How ya doing?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Better.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's ironic isn't it? I mean I'm in the hospital for not getting enough water, and you're in it for a disease that causes the fear of water.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'm in because you hit me with your car. But I wanted to say, I heard you were trying really hard, so I'm not mad at you anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, I'm not mad at you anymore. [sighs, takes sucker out of his mouth] Wanna share?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not really sick. [Meredith takes a lick and hands back to Michael] Nah, I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you ever think of this? Would a sober person walk in front of a car?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ay-o!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, are you saying that Meredith was drunk at 9 AM?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's despicable.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Someone
Quote.Text: That's not cool.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There's no proof of that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That seems early, even for her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's not what...no, no, I'm not saying that, that's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Drunk? No! You can't get drunk off Kahlua. It's just a kind of coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Then... what are you saying?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am saying... that... maybe I was drunk. Did you ever think of that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Definitely not.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That'd be DUI.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe she hit me. You ever think of that? She hit me? I don't know whose fault it was. I wasn't exactly looking at the road.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Toby. [walks past him to Kelly's cubicle]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kelly, we're going to visit Meredith at lunch. [Kelly's lying down on floor, head unseen under desk. She rolls to her side, away from Pam] Kelly?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, Kelly's been so upset about Ryan dumping her, that she can't even talk. [grins]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [from under desk] I don't want to talk to anybody about Ryan! Please, go away!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: They don't have this kind of technology at the vet's. It's not far.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's fair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, why don't go around the room and say one memory of Meredith. I'll start. I liked her jumpers. They reminded me of Kindergarten. Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'll always remember Meredith's back. That's all I can see from my desk. All that red hair, over a nice strong back. Sometimes I pretend it's Carrot Top, and he's going to turn around and tell a joke.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, how's the view old girl? [looking out windows] Oh! There's a cemetery. You think that's affiliated with the hospital, or is it a like a separate feature...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Okay, okay, okay, You can just close that.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Bye, Meredith. Here you go. We got you some balloons.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: See you guys. [chorus of goodbyes, all but Michael file out as he's talking, Creed takes Meredith's pills]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's just... Why can't you just forgive... Why, why are you having such a hard time laughing this off? How do you know that you weren't born with some sort of abnormal pelvis that it was just bound to crack at some point?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh please, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm not going to leave until you forgive me.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're gonna be here a long time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing for a while, sighs, turns to walk out] Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nurse! I just need some water. And my pills. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Nurse
Quote.Text: There you go.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: There's nothing in here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This office is cursed. [sighs] And we need to do something about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Conference room?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Maybe the conference room, maybe the annex. I'm just saying, at least right here [indicates floor in front of his office] is cursed. Conference room, 10 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: On the one hand, it's a relief to know that it's not just me, the whole office is cursed. On the other hand, I may have to deal with the dark unknown.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Question: Has anyone recently offended a Gypsy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have to have done something wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You ran over an employee.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was the curse, Stanley, and we are trying to find the cause of the curse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Mmm. [nods]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, are you Santaria?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I was raised Catholic, but I'm agnostic now, so I guess I'm a secular humanist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. Great. We have a secular humanist here, that is disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael, do you know what secular humanism is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes. It is a philosophy which says people can improve their lives by using reason instead of religion or superstition.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My cousin Mose's best friend was a dog. One day, he was foaming at the mouth, so I had to shoot him dead. Turns out, he had only eaten one of Mose's cream pies. Did I feel bad for killing him? No. That's how you deal with a thief.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, the, uh, the charity's having some financial problems. What do I look like to you, Paul Newman? That's actually not a good example, because I have been compared to a young Paul Newman, my eyes and my face. And I make my own salad dressing. I mix Newman's Ranch with Newman's Italian. Sell it at flea markets for a slight loss. I could make... I could make a profit if I changed one of the ingredients to Wishbone [shakes head] but I won't do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoa, 'scuse me! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Let... let's pick it up, Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, slow! Oh, ho, ho, ho. [laughing as he passes Phyllis and Bob] You guys are going so slow...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Go get him Bobby!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, I'm going backwards.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sic him!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, all right! All right! All right! All right!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sic him!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay! [Bob Vance and Michael in an all-out sprint, Michael grunting]

Quote.Speaker: Pediatrician
Quote.Text: You're gonna be just fine, Michael! You're gonna have a good life.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pediatrician
Quote.Text: Lots of people suffer dehydration; they all recover just fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pediatrician
Quote.Text: I'm Michael's pediatrician. Dehydration's pretty simple. He could also have been treated by a Boy Scout leader, a coach, or a, a... a water bottle.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, apparently, my insurance will not be covering this hospital stay. I will be paying out-of-pocket. Um... I kinda wish I'd been hit by a car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, doc? You forgetting something? [pediatrician takes a lollypop from his pocket and gives it to Michael] Thank you.
